meanings.definition: An optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions, especially the appearance of a sheet of water in a desert or on a hot road caused by the refraction of light.
meanings.sent1: The travelers in the desert were amazed by the mirages that made them see water where there was none.
meanings.sent2: The mirages on the road made it look like there was a lake ahead, but it was just a trick of the light.
meanings.sent3: The mirages in the desert played a funny game on the tired explorers, making them think they were near an oasis.
meanings.sent4: The mirages danced on the horizon, teasing the travelers with visions of water that vanished when they got closer.
meanings.sent5: The mirages shimmered in the distance, creating a beautiful but false image of a watery paradise.

meanings.definition: Something that appears real or possible but is not actually so.
meanings.sent1: The promise of easy money turned out to be just mirages, disappearing when it was time to pay up.
meanings.sent2: His dreams of fame were like mirages, fading away when faced with the harsh reality of the industry.
meanings.sent3: The mirages of success lured him into risky ventures that led to disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The mirages of happiness in material possessions left him feeling empty and unsatisfied.
meanings.sent5: The mirages of love blinded her to the true intentions of those around her.
